In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here's the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in split(text, ' ')
        new_word_width = sizeof(word)
        
        if new_word_width + sizeof(current_line) <= text_width
            current_line *= " " * new_word_width
            push!(current_line, word)
        else
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)
    join(lines, "\n")
end
```
Here's an example usage of the function:
```julia
text = """
This is a very long text that we want to wrap into multiple lines. It will exceed the specified `text_width` if not wrapped properly.
"""

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 25)
println(wrapped_text)
```
The output would be a multi-line string with words wrapping when the `text_width` limit is reached.
